wisdom.sentence: A "practical joker" deserves applause for his wit according to its quality. Bastinado is about right.  For exceptional wit one might grant keelhauling. But staking him out on an anthill should be reserved for the very wittiest.
wisdom.author: Lazarus Long

wisdom.sentence: A 'full' life in my experience is usually full only of other people's demands.
A bore is a man who talks so much about himself that you can't talk about yourself.
A bore is someone who persists in holding his own views after we have enlightened him with ours.
A city is a large community where people are lonesome together
wisdom.author: Herbert Prochnow

wisdom.sentence: A compliment is something like a kiss through a veil.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo

wisdom.sentence: A cynic is a person searching for an honest man, with a stolen lantern.
wisdom.author: Edgar A. Shoaff

wisdom.sentence: A fair exterior is a silent recommendation.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.sentence: A friend is a present you give yourself.
wisdom.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

wisdom.sentence: A healthy male adult bore consumes each year one and a half times his own weight in other people's patience.
wisdom.author: John Updike

wisdom.sentence: A man of genius makes no mistakes. His errors are volitional and are the portals of discovery.

wisdom.sentence: A man pleaded innocent of any wrong doing when caught by the police during a raid at the home of a mobster, excusing himself by claiming that he was making a bolt for the door.
A man who keeps stealing mopeds is an obvious cycle-path.
A man who turns green has eschewed protein.
A man with 3 wings and a dictionary is cousin to the turkey.
A narcissist is someone better looking than you are.

wisdom.sentence: A paranoid is a man who knows a little of what's going on.
wisdom.author: William S. Burroughs

wisdom.sentence: A pat on the back is only a few centimeters from a kick in the pants.

wisdom.sentence: A person forgives only when they are in the wrong.
A person is just about as big as the things that make them angry.

A pessimist is a man who has been compelled to live with an optimist.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.sentence: A prig is a fellow who is always making you a present of his opinions.
wisdom.author: George Eliot

wisdom.sentence: A private sin is not so prejudicial in the world as a public indecency.
wisdom.author: Miguel de Cervantes

wisdom.sentence: A real friend isn't someone you use once and then throw away. A real friend is someone you can use over and over again.
A real person has two reasons for doing anything ... a good reason and the real reason.

wisdom.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

wisdom.sentence: A sadist is a masochist who follows the Golden Rule.
A total abstainer is one who abstains from everything but abstention, and especially from inactivity in the affairs of others.

wisdom.sentence: A truly great man will neither trample on a worm nor sneak to an emperor.
wisdom.author: B. Franklin

wisdom.sentence: A well adjusted person is one who makes the same mistake twice without getting nervous.

Accept people for what they are -- completely unacceptable.
According to the obituary notices, a mean and unimportant person never dies.
Advice is a dangerous gift; be cautious about giving and receiving it.
Advice to young men: Be ascetic, and if you can't be ascetic, then at least be aseptic.
After all, it is only the mediocre who are always at their best.
wisdom.author: Jean Giraudoux

wisdom.sentence: After living in New York, you trust nobody, but you believe everything. Just in case.
After Snow White used a couple rolls of film taking pictures of the seven dwarfs, she mailed the roll to be developed.  Later she was heard to sing, "Some day my prints will come."
Against stupidity the very gods Themselves contend in vain.
wisdom.author: Friedrich von Schiller, "The Maid of Orleans", III, 6

wisdom.sentence: Ah say, son, you're about as sharp as a bowlin' ball.
Ah, sweet Springtime, when a young man lightly turns his fancy over!
Al didn't smile for forty years.  You've got to admire a man like that.
wisdom.author: from "Mary Hartman, Mary Hartman"

wisdom.sentence: All God's children are not beautiful.  Most of God's children are, in fact, barely presentable.

wisdom.sentence: All his life he has looked away... to the horizon, to the sky, to the future.	Never his mind on where he was, on what he was doing.

wisdom.sentence: All I ask of life is a constant and exaggerated sense of my own importance.
All I want is a warm bed and a kind word and unlimited power.
wisdom.author: Ashleigh Brilliant

wisdom.sentence: All men have the right to wait in line.
All men profess honesty as long as they can.  To believe all men honest would be folly.	 To believe none so is something worse.
wisdom.author: John Quincy Adams

wisdom.sentence: All most people want is a little more than they'll ever get.

"All my life I wanted to be someone; I guess I should have been more specific."
wisdom.author: Jane Wagner

wisdom.sentence: All of the animals except man know that the principal business of life is to enjoy it.

wisdom.author: Susan Sontag

wisdom.sentence: All progress is based upon a universal innate desire of every organism to live beyond its income.

wisdom.sentence: All the world's a stage and most of us are desperately unrehearsed.

wisdom.sentence: Always borrow money from a pessimist; he doesn't expect to be paid back.

wisdom.sentence: America's best buy for a quarter is a telephone call to the right person.
An effective way to deal with predators is to taste terrible.
An evil mind is a great comfort.
An expert is a person who avoids the small errors as he sweeps on to the grand fallacy.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Stolberg

wisdom.sentence: An expert is one who knows more and more about less and less until he knows absolutely everything about nothing.

wisdom.sentence: An infallible method of conciliating a tiger is to allow oneself to be devoured.

wisdom.sentence: An intellectual is someone whose mind watches itself.
wisdom.author: Albert Camus

wisdom.sentence: An optimist is a guy that has never had much experience.
wisdom.author: Don Marquis

wisdom.sentence: And on the eighth day, we bulldozed it.
Anger is momentary madness.
wisdom.author: Horace

wisdom.sentence: Anger kills as surely as the other vices.

wisdom.author: Lazarus Long

wisdom.sentence: Any clod can have the facts, but having opinions is an art.

wisdom.sentence: Any fool can tell the truth, but it requires a man of sense to know how to lie well.

wisdom.sentence: Any man who hates dogs and babies can't be all bad.

wisdom.sentence: Anybody can win, unless there happens to be a second entry.

Anyone stupid enough to be caught by the police is probably guilty.

"Apathy is not the problem, it's the solution"
Appearances often are deceiving.

wisdom.sentence: Argue for your limitations, and sure enough, they're yours.

wisdom.sentence: Arguments are extremely vulgar, for everyone in good society holds exactly the same opinion.

wisdom.sentence: "Arguments with furniture are rarely productive."
wisdom.author: Kehlog Albran, "The Profit"

wisdom.sentence: As crazy as hauling timber into the woods.
wisdom.author: Quintus Horatius Flaccus (Horace)

wisdom.sentence: As you grow older, you will still do foolish things, but you will do them with much more enthusiasm.
wisdom.author: The Cowboy

wisdom.sentence: Ask not what's inside your head, but what your head's inside of.
wisdom.author: J.J. Gibson

wisdom.sentence: Ask yourself whether you are happy and you cease to be so.
wisdom.author: John Stuart Mill

wisdom.sentence: At no time is freedom of speech more precious than when a man hits his thumb with a hammer.

wisdom.sentence: Back when I was a boy, it was 40 miles to everywhere, uphill both ways and it was always snowing.

wisdom.sentence: Be braver -- you can't cross a chasm in two small jumps.

wisdom.author: James Baldwin, "Nobody Knows My Name"

wisdom.sentence: Be incomprehensible.  If they can't understand, they can't disagree.
Be independent.	 Insult a rich relative today.
Be nice to people on the way up, because you'll meet them on your way down.
wisdom.author: Wilson Mizner

wisdom.sentence: Be not anxious about what you have, but about what you are.
wisdom.author: Pope St. Gregory I

wisdom.sentence: Be open to other people -- they may enrich your dream.

wisdom.sentence: Beauty may be skin deep, but ugly goes clear to the bone.

wisdom.sentence: Before borrowing money from a friend, decide which you need more.

wisdom.sentence: Before destruction a man's heart is haughty, but humility goes before honour.

wisdom.sentence: Being popular is important.  Otherwise people might not like you.

wisdom.sentence: Beware of self-styled experts: an ex is a has-been, and a spurt is a drip under pressure.

BEWARE!	 People acting under the influence of human nature.

wisdom.sentence: Blessed are they that have nothing to say, and who cannot be persuaded to say it.

wisdom.sentence: Blessed is he who expects no gratitude, for he shall not be disappointed.

wisdom.sentence: Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.

wisdom.sentence: Blessed is he who has reached the point of no return and knows it, for he shall enjoy living.

wisdom.sentence: Blessed is the man who, having nothing to say, abstains from giving wordy evidence of the fact.

wisdom.sentence: Bounders get bound when they are caught bounding.

wisdom.sentence: Buck-passing usually turns out to be a boomerang.

"But officer, I was only trying to gain enough speed so I could coast to the nearest gas station."

wisdom.sentence: By doing just a little every day, you can gradually let the task completely overwhelm you.

wisdom.sentence: Calling you stupid is an insult to stupid people!
wisdom.author: Wanda, "A Fish Called Wanda"

wisdom.sentence: Can you buy friendship?	 You not only can, you must.  It's the only way to obtain friends.  Everything worthwhile has a price.

wisdom.sentence: Certainly there are things in life that money can't buy, But it's very funny -- did you ever try buying them without money?

wisdom.sentence: Character is what you are in the dark!

wisdom.sentence: Charlie Brown:	Why was I put on this earth? Linus:		To make others happy. Charlie Brown:	Why were others put on this earth?

wisdom.sentence: Class: when they're running you out of town, to look like you're leading the parade.

wisdom.sentence: Clones are people two.
Cloning is the sincerest form of flattery.

wisdom.sentence: Common sense is instinct, and enough of it is genius.

wisdom.sentence: Common sense is the collection of prejudices acquired by age eighteen.

wisdom.sentence: Common sense is the most evenly distributed quantity in the world. Everyone thinks he has enough.
wisdom.author: Descartes, 1637

wisdom.sentence: Conceit causes more conversation than wit.

wisdom.sentence: Confess your sins to the Lord and you will be forgiven; confess them to man and you will be laughed at.

wisdom.sentence: Confession is good for the soul only in the sense that a tweed coat is good for dandruff.

wisdom.sentence: Confession is good for the soul, but bad for the career.

wisdom.sentence: Confidence is simply that quiet, assured feeling you have before you fall flat on your face.

wisdom.sentence: Confidence is the feeling you have before you understand the situation.

wisdom.sentence: Conscience is the inner voice that warns us somebody may be looking.

wisdom.sentence: Conscience is what hurts when everything else feels so good.

wisdom.sentence: Conversation enriches the understanding, but solitude is the school of genius.

wisdom.sentence: Correction does much, but encouragement does more.

wisdom.sentence: Courage is fear that has said its prayers.

wisdom.sentence: Dare to be naive.

wisdom.sentence: Dave Mack:	"Your stupidity, Allen, is simply not up to par." Allen Gwinn:	"Yours is."

wisdom.sentence: Delay is preferable to error.

wisdom.sentence: Dishonor will not trouble me, once I am dead.
wisdom.author: Euripides

wisdom.sentence: Do not think by infection, catching an opinion like a cold.

wisdom.sentence: Do you mean that you not only want a wrong answer, but a certain wrong answer?

wisdom.sentence: Don't remember what you can infer.

wisdom.sentence: Don't say "yes" until I finish talking.

wisdom.sentence: Don't shoot until you're sure you both aren't on the same side.

wisdom.sentence: Don't tell me that worry doesn't do any good.  I know better.  The things I worry about don't happen.

wisdom.sentence: Don't try to outweird me, three-eyes.  I get stranger things than you free with my breakfast cereal.

wisdom.sentence: Don't worry about avoiding temptation -- as you grow older, it starts avoiding you.

wisdom.sentence: Don't worry about people stealing your ideas.  If your ideas are any good, you'll have to ram them down people's throats.

wisdom.sentence: Drive defensively.  Buy a tank.
Early to bed and early to rise and you'll be groggy when everyone else is wide awake.
Elevators smell different to midgets.
Enjoy your life; be pleasant and gay, like the birds in May.
Enjoy yourself while you're still old.
Envy is a pain of mind that successful men cause their neighbors.

wisdom.sentence: Etiquette is for those with no breeding; fashion for those with no taste.
Even a hawk is an eagle among crows.
Even God lends a hand to honest boldness.
wisdom.author: Menander

wisdom.sentence: Even if you persuade me, you won't persuade me.
wisdom.author: Aristophanes

wisdom.sentence: Even if you're on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there.
wisdom.author: Will Rogers

wisdom.sentence: Even moderation ought not to be practiced to excess.
Every improvement in communication makes the bore more terrible.
wisdom.author: Frank Moore Colby

wisdom.sentence: Every man is as God made him, ay, and often worse.
wisdom.author: Miguel de Cervantes

wisdom.sentence: Every man takes the limits of his own field of vision for the limits of the world.
wisdom.author: Schopenhauer

wisdom.sentence: Every time I look at you I am more convinced of Darwin's theory.

wisdom.author: Humphrey Bogart

wisdom.sentence: Everybody is somebody else's weirdo.

wisdom.sentence: Everybody wants to go to heaven, but nobody wants to die.
Everyone complains of his memory, no one of his judgement.
Everyone hates me because I'm paranoid.
Everyone is a genius.  It's just that some people are too stupid to realize it.
Everyone is entitled to my opinion.
Everyone is more or less mad on one point.
wisdom.author: Rudyard Kipling

wisdom.sentence: Everyone talks about apathy, but no one does anything about it.

wisdom.sentence: Everyone was born right-handed.	 Only the greatest overcome it.
Everyone's in a high place when you're on your knees.

wisdom.author: H.L. Mencken

wisdom.sentence: Example is not the main thing in influencing others.  It is the only thing.
wisdom.author: Albert Schweitzer

wisdom.sentence: Excess on occasion is exhilarating.  It prevents moderation from acquiring the deadening effect of a habit.

wisdom.sentence: Exhilaration is that feeling you get just after a great idea hits you, and just before you realize what is wrong with it.

wisdom.author: Aldous Huxley

wisdom.sentence: Experience is that marvelous thing that enables you recognize a mistake when you make it again.
wisdom.author: Franklin P. Jones

wisdom.sentence: Experience is what causes a person to make new mistakes instead of old ones.
Experience is what you get when you didn't get what you wanted.
Experience is what you get when you were expecting something else.

wisdom.sentence: Fame may be fleeting but obscurity is forever.
Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.sentence: Fashions have done more harm than revolutions.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo

wisdom.sentence: Flattery is like cologne -- to be smelled, but not swallowed.
wisdom.author: Josh Billings

wisdom.sentence: For an idea to be fashionable is ominous, since it must afterwards be always old-fashioned.
For every action, there is an equal and opposite criticism.
wisdom.author: Harrison

wisdom.sentence: For every credibility gap, there is a gullibility fill.
wisdom.author: R. Clopton

wisdom.sentence: For I do not do the good I want, but the evil I do not want is what I do.
wisdom.author: Paul of Tarsus, (Saint Paul)

wisdom.sentence: For men use, if they have an evil turn, to write it in marble: and whoso doth us a good turn we write it in dust.
wisdom.author: Sir Thomas More

wisdom.sentence: For most men life is a search for the proper manila envelope in which to get themselves filed.
wisdom.author: Clifton Fadiman

wisdom.sentence: For people who like that kind of book, that is the kind of book they will like.

For those who like this sort of thing, this is the sort of thing they like.
wisdom.author: Abraham Lincoln

wisdom.sentence: "For three days after death hair and fingernails continue to grow but phone calls taper off."
wisdom.author: Johnny Carson

wisdom.sentence: Four fifths of the perjury in the world is expended on tombstones, women and competitors.
wisdom.author: Lord Thomas Dewar

wisdom.sentence: Friends may come and go, but enemies accumulate.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jones

wisdom.sentence: Friendships last when each friend thinks he has a slight superiority over the other.
wisdom.author: Honore DeBalzac

wisdom.sentence: Genius is the talent of a person who is dead.
Genius may have its limitations, but stupidity is not thus handicapped.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.sentence: Get forgiveness now -- tomorrow you may no longer feel guilty.
Give me a sleeping pill and tell me your troubles.
Go out and tell a lie that will make the whole family proud of you.
wisdom.author: Cadmus, to Pentheus, in "The Bacchae" by Euripides

wisdom.sentence: Go slowly to the entertainments of thy friends, but quickly to their misfortunes.
wisdom.author: Chilo

wisdom.sentence: God gives us relatives; thank goodness we can chose our friends.
God must love the common man; He made so many of them.
Good advice is one of those insults that ought to be forgiven.
Good advice is something a man gives when he is too old to set a bad example.
wisdom.author: La Rouchefoucauld

wisdom.sentence: Good judgement comes from experience.  Experience comes from bad judgement.
wisdom.author: Jim Horning

wisdom.sentence: Gratitude, like love, is never a dependable international emotion.
wisdom.author: Joseph Alsop

wisdom.sentence: Great minds run in great circles.
Greatness is a transitory experience. It is never consistent.
Growing old isn't bad when you consider the alternatives.
wisdom.author: Maurice Chevalier

wisdom.sentence: Half of being smart is knowing what you're dumb at.

Hate the sin and love the sinner.

wisdom.sentence: Have no friends not equal to yourself.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.sentence: Having no talent is no longer enough.
wisdom.author: Gore Vidal

wisdom.sentence: He had occasional flashes of silence that made his conversation perfectly delightful.
wisdom.author: Sydney Smith

wisdom.sentence: He hadn't a single redeeming vice.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.sentence: He is a man capable of turning any colour into grey.
wisdom.author: John LeCarre

wisdom.sentence: He is considered a most graceful speaker who can say nothing in the most words.
He is not only dull himself, he is the cause of dullness in others.
wisdom.author: Samuel Johnson

wisdom.sentence: He laughs at every joke three times... once when it's told, once when it's explained, and once when he understands it.

wisdom.author: Ring Lardner

wisdom.sentence: He missed an invaluable opportunity to hold his tongue.
wisdom.author: Andrew Lang

wisdom.sentence: He only knew his iron spine held up the sky -- he didn't realize his brain had fallen to the ground.
wisdom.author: The Book of Serenity

wisdom.sentence: He thinks by infection, catching an opinion like a cold.
He walks as if balancing the family tree on his nose.
He was so narrow-minded he could see through a keyhole with both eyes.
He who always plows a straight furrow is in a rut.
He who despises himself nevertheless esteems himself as a self-despiser.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.sentence: He who hoots with owls by night cannot soar with eagles by day.
He who is flogged by fate and laughs the louder is a masochist.
He who is good for making excuses is seldom good for anything else.
He who is known as an early riser need not get up until noon.
He who minds his own business is never unemployed.
He who walks on burning coals is sure to get burned.
wisdom.author: Sinbad

wisdom.sentence: He who wonders discovers that this in itself is wonder.
wisdom.author: M.C. Escher

wisdom.sentence: He's the kind of guy, that, well, if you were ever in a jam he'd be there... with two slices of bread and some chunky peanut butter.
"He's the kind of man for the times that need the kind of man he is ..."
Here I am, fifty-eight, and I still don't know what I want to be when I grow up.
wisdom.author: Peter Drucker

wisdom.sentence: Hi!  I'm Larry.	 This is my brother Bob, and this is my other brother Jimbo.	We thought you might like to know the names of your assailants.
Hindsight is always 20:20.
wisdom.author: Billy Wilder

wisdom.sentence: Hindsight is an exact science.
His life was formal; his actions seemed ruled with a ruler.
His mind is like a steel trap: full of mice.
wisdom.author: Foghorn Leghorn

wisdom.sentence: History repeats itself -- the first time as a tragi-comedy, the second time as bedroom farce.
History repeats itself only if one does not listen the first time.
History repeats itself.	 That's one thing wrong with history.
Home is the place where, when you have to go there, they have to take you in.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost, "The Death of the Hired Man"

wisdom.sentence: Home life as we understand it is no more natural to us than a cage is to a cockatoo.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.sentence: Hope is a good breakfast, but it is a bad supper.
wisdom.author: Francis Bacon

wisdom.sentence: Hope is a waking dream.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.sentence: Hope not, lest ye be disappointed.
wisdom.author: M. Horner

wisdom.sentence: How comes it to pass, then, that we appear such cowards in reasoning, and are so afraid to stand the test of ridicule?
wisdom.author: A. Cooper

wisdom.sentence: How long a minute is depends on which side of the bathroom door you're on.
How many "coming men" has one known!  Where on earth do they all go to?
wisdom.author: Sir Arthur Wing Pinero

wisdom.sentence: However, never daunted, I will cope with adversity in my traditional manner ... sulking and nausea.
wisdom.author: Tom K. Ryan

wisdom.sentence: Human kind cannot bear very much reality.
wisdom.author: T.S. Eliot, "Four Quartets: Burnt Norton"

wisdom.sentence: Humans are communications junkies.  We just can't get enough.
wisdom.author: Alan Kay

wisdom.sentence: Humility is the first of the virtues -- for other people.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

wisdom.sentence: I allow the world to live as it chooses, and I allow myself to live as I choose.
I always choose my friends for their good looks and my enemies for their good intellects.  Man cannot be too careful in his choice of enemies.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, "The Picture of Dorian Gray"

wisdom.sentence: I always pass on good advice.  It is the only thing to do with it. It is never any good to oneself.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, "An Ideal Husband"

wisdom.sentence: I always say beauty is only sin deep.
wisdom.author: Saki, "Reginald's Choir Treat"

wisdom.sentence: I am an optimist.  It does not seem too much use being anything else.
wisdom.author: Winston Churchill

wisdom.sentence: I am firm.  You are obstinate.	He is a pig-headed fool.
wisdom.author: Katharine Whitehorn

wisdom.sentence: I am looking for a honest man.
wisdom.author: Diogenes the Cynic

wisdom.sentence: "I am ready to meet my Maker.  Whether my Maker is prepared for the great ordeal of meeting me is another matter."
wisdom.author: Winston Churchill

wisdom.sentence: I believe in getting into hot water; it keeps you clean.
wisdom.author: G.K. Chesterton

wisdom.sentence: I call them as I see them.  If I can't see them, I make them up.
wisdom.author: Biff Barf

wisdom.sentence: I can give you my word, but I know what it's worth and you don't.
wisdom.author: Nero Wolfe, "Over My Dead Body"

wisdom.sentence: I can write better than anybody who can write faster, and I can write faster than anybody who can write better.
wisdom.author: A.J. Liebling

wisdom.sentence: I can't seem to bring myself to say, "Well, I guess I'll be toddling along." It isn't that I can't toddle.  It's that I can't guess I'll toddle.
wisdom.author: Robert Benchley

wisdom.sentence: I can't stand squealers; hit that guy.
wisdom.author: Albert Anastasia

wisdom.sentence: I can't understand it.	I can't even understand the people who can understand it.
wisdom.author: Queen Juliana of the Netherlands.

wisdom.sentence: I can't understand why people are frightened of new ideas.  I'm frightened of the old ones.
wisdom.author: John Cage

wisdom.sentence: I cannot and will not cut my conscience to fit this year's fashions.
wisdom.author: Lillian Hellman

wisdom.sentence: I consider the day misspent that I am not either charged with a crime, or arrested for one.
wisdom.author: "Ratsy" Tourbillon

wisdom.sentence: I didn't get sophisticated -- I just got tired.	 But maybe that's what sophisticated is -- being tired.
wisdom.author: Rita Gain

wisdom.sentence: "I didn't know it was impossible when I did it."
I disagree with what you say, but will defend to the death your right to tell such LIES!
I do not know myself and God forbid that I should.
wisdom.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

wisdom.sentence: I don't know who my grandfather was; I am much more concerned to know what his grandson will be.
wisdom.author: Abraham Lincoln

wisdom.sentence: I don't know why we're here, I say we all go home and free associate.
I don't make the rules, Gil, I only play the game.
wisdom.author: Cash McCall

wisdom.sentence: I don't mind arguing with myself.  It's when I lose that it bothers me.
wisdom.author: Richard Powers

wisdom.sentence: I don't remember it, but I have it written down.
"I don't think they could put him in a mental hospital.	 On the other hand, if he were already in, I don't think they'd let him out."
I don't want to bore you, but there's nobody else around for me to bore.
I either want less decadence or more chance to participate in it.
I generally avoid temptation unless I can't resist it.
wisdom.author: Mae West

wisdom.sentence: I give you the man who -- the man who -- uh, I forgets the man who?
wisdom.author: Beauregard Bugleboy

wisdom.sentence: I got vision, and the rest of the world wears bifocals.
wisdom.author: Butch Cassidy

wisdom.sentence: I guess I've been wrong all my life, but so have billions of other people... Certainty is just an emotion.
wisdom.author: Hal Clement

wisdom.sentence: I hate mankind, for I think myself one of the best of them, and I know how bad I am.
wisdom.author: Samuel Johnson

wisdom.sentence: I hate small towns because once you've seen the cannon in the park there's nothing else to do.
wisdom.author: Lenny Bruce

wisdom.sentence: I have discovered that all human evil comes from this, man's being unable to sit still in a room.
wisdom.author: Blaise Pascal

wisdom.sentence: I have found little that is good about human beings.  In my experience most of them are trash.
wisdom.author: Sigmund Freud

wisdom.sentence: I have great faith in fools -- self confidence my friends call it.
wisdom.author: Edgar Allan Poe

wisdom.sentence: I have learned silence from the talkative, toleration from the intolerant, and kindness from the unkind.
wisdom.author: Kahlil Gibran

wisdom.sentence: I have made mistakes but I have never made the mistake of claiming that I have never made one.
wisdom.author: James Gordon Bennett

wisdom.sentence: I knew one thing: as soon as anyone said you didn't need a gun, you'd better take one along that worked.
wisdom.author: Raymond Chandler

wisdom.sentence: I love mankind ... It's people I hate.
wisdom.author: Schulz

wisdom.sentence: "I may appear to be just sitting here like a bucket of tapioca, but don't let appearances fool you.  I'm approaching old age ... at the speed of light."
wisdom.author: Prof. Cosmo Fishhawk

wisdom.sentence: I may be getting older, but I refuse to grow up!
I may not be totally perfect, but parts of me are excellent.
wisdom.author: Ashleigh Brilliant

wisdom.sentence: I never killed a man that didn't deserve it.
wisdom.author: Mickey Cohen

wisdom.sentence: I prefer rogues to imbeciles because they sometimes take a rest.
wisdom.author: Alexandre Dumas, fils

wisdom.sentence: I profoundly believe it takes a lot of practice to become a moral slob.
wisdom.author: William F. Buckley

wisdom.sentence: I sometimes think that God, in creating man, somewhat overestimated his ability.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.sentence: I think I'm schizophrenic.  One half of me's paranoid and the other half's out to get him.
I used to think that the brain was the most wonderful organ in my body.  Then I realized who was telling me this.
wisdom.author: Emo Phillips

wisdom.sentence: I waited and waited and when no message came I knew it must be from you.
I will follow the good side right to the fire, but not into it if I can help it.
wisdom.author: Michel Eyquem de Montaigne

wisdom.sentence: I'll defend to the death your right to say that, but I never said I'd listen to it!
wisdom.author: Tom Galloway with apologies to Voltaire

wisdom.sentence: I'll give you my opinion of the human race in a nutshell ... their heart's in the right place, but their head is a thoroughly inefficient organ.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, "The Summing Up"

wisdom.sentence: I'll pretend to trust you if you'll pretend to trust me.
I'm not the person your mother warned you about... her imagination isn't that good.
wisdom.author: Amy Gorin

wisdom.sentence: "I'm really enjoying not talking to you ... Let's not talk again REAL soon ..."
I'm so miserable without you, it's almost like you're here.
I'm sorry if the correct way of doing things offends you.
I'm sorry, but my karma just ran over your dogma.
I'm successful because I'm lucky.   The harder I work, the luckier I get.
I've already told you more than I know.
I've found my niche.  If you're wondering why I'm not there, there was this little hole in the bottom ...
wisdom.author: John Croll

wisdom.sentence: I've given up reading books; I find it takes my mind off myself.
I've known him as a man, as an adolescent and as a child -- sometimes on the same day.
"I've seen, I SAY, I've seen better heads on a mug of beer"
wisdom.author: Senator Claghorn

wisdom.sentence: Ideas don't stay in some minds very long because they don't like solitary confinement.
If a man has talent and cannot use it, he has failed.
wisdom.author: Thomas Wolfe

wisdom.sentence: If God had intended Man to Walk, He would have given him Feet.
If God had meant for us to be naked, we would have been born that way.
If God had really intended men to fly, he'd make it easier to get to the airport.
wisdom.author: George Winters

wisdom.sentence: If God had wanted you to go around nude, He would have given you bigger hands.
If God hadn't wanted you to be paranoid, He wouldn't have given you such a vivid imagination.
If God wanted us to be brave, why did he give us legs?
wisdom.author: Marvin Kitman

wisdom.sentence: If he should ever change his faith, it'll be because he no longer thinks he's God.
If I'm over the hill, why is it I don't recall ever being on top?
wisdom.author: Jerry Muscha

wisdom.sentence: If man is only a little lower than the angels, the angels should reform.
wisdom.author: Mary Wilson Little

wisdom.sentence: If one studies too zealously, one easily loses his pants.
wisdom.author: A. Einstein.

wisdom.sentence: If one tells the truth, one is sure, sooner or later, to be found out.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, "Phrases and Philosophies for the Use 		of the Young"

wisdom.sentence: If only I could be respected without having to be respectable.
If only one could get that wonderful feeling of accomplishment without having to accomplish anything.
If only you had a personality instead of an attitude.
If opportunity came disguised as temptation, one knock would be enough.
If people are good only because they fear punishment, and hope for reward, then we are a sorry lot indeed.

wisdom.sentence: If people see that you mean them no harm, they'll never hurt you, nine times out of ten!
If practice makes perfect, and nobody's perfect, why practice?
If some people didn't tell you, you'd never know they'd been away on vacation.
If someone says he will do something "without fail", he won't.
If there is a wrong way to do something, then someone will do it.

wisdom.sentence: If there was any justice in the world, "trust" would be a four-letter word.
If things don't improve soon, you'd better ask them to stop helping you.
"If we were meant to fly, we wouldn't keep losing our luggage."
If we were meant to get up early, God would have created us with alarm clocks.
If you are a fatalist, what can you do about it?
wisdom.author: Ann Edwards-Duff

wisdom.sentence: If you are honest because honesty is the best policy, your honesty is corrupt.
If you can keep your head when all about you are losing theirs, then you clearly don't understand the situation.
If you can't say anything good about someone, sit right here by me.
wisdom.author: Alice Roosevelt Longworth

wisdom.sentence: If you cannot in the long run tell everyone what you have been doing, your doing was worthless.
wisdom.author: Edwim Schrodinger

wisdom.sentence: If you continually give you will continually have.
If you didn't get caught, did you really do it?
If you didn't have most of your friends, you wouldn't have most of your problems.
If you do not wish a man to do a thing, you had better get him to talk about it; for the more men talk, the more likely they are to do nothing else.

wisdom.sentence: If you don't care where you are, then you ain't lost.
If you don't do it, you'll never know what would have happened if you had done it.
If you don't do the things that are not worth doing, who will?
If you don't go to other men's funerals they won't go to yours.

wisdom.sentence: If you don't have a nasty obituary you probably didn't matter.

wisdom.sentence: If you don't like the way I drive, stay off the sidewalk!

wisdom.sentence: If you explain so clearly that nobody can misunderstand, somebody will.
If you flaunt it, expect to have it trashed.
If you float on instinct alone, how can you calculate the buoyancy for the computed load?
wisdom.author: Christopher Hodder-Williams

wisdom.sentence: If you go out of your mind, do it quietly, so as not to disturb those around you.
If you had any brains, you'd be dangerous.
If you just try long enough and hard enough, you can always manage to boot yourself in the posterior.
wisdom.author: A.J. Liebling, "The Press"

wisdom.sentence: If you keep your mind sufficiently open, people will throw a lot of rubbish into it.
wisdom.author: William Orton

wisdom.sentence: If you lived today as if it were your last, you'd buy up a box of rockets and fire them all off, wouldn't you?
wisdom.author: Garrison Keillor

wisdom.sentence: If you look good and dress well, you don't need a purpose in life.

wisdom.sentence: If you make people think they're thinking, they'll love you; but if you really make them think they'll hate you.

wisdom.sentence: If you notice that a person is deceiving you, they must not be deceiving you very well.

wisdom.author: Thomas Szasz

wisdom.sentence: If you think before you speak the other guy gets his joke in first.

wisdom.sentence: If you think things can't get worse it's probably only because you lack sufficient imagination.
If you try to please everyone, somebody is not going to like it.
If you want to know how old a man is, ask his brother-in-law.

If you would understand your own age, read the works of fiction produced in it.	People in disguise speak freely.
If you're careful enough, nothing bad or good will ever happen to you.
If you're constantly being mistreated, you're cooperating with the treatment.
If you're going to do something tonight that you'll be sorry for tomorrow morning, sleep late.

wisdom.sentence: If you're happy, you're successful.
If you're not very clever you should be conciliatory.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Disraeli

wisdom.sentence: In good speaking, should not the mind of the speaker know the truth of the matter about which he is to speak?
wisdom.author: Plato

wisdom.sentence: In matters of principle, stand like a rock; in matters of taste, swim with the current.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.sentence: In most instances, all an argument proves is that two people are present.

wisdom.author: Alan Kay

wisdom.sentence: In the misfortune of our friends we find something that is not displeasing to us.
wisdom.author: La Rochefoucauld, "Maxims"

wisdom.sentence: In this world some people are going to like me and some are not.  So, I may as well be me.	Then I know if someone likes me, they like me.

wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.sentence: Innocence ends when one is stripped of the delusion that one likes oneself.
wisdom.author: Joan Didion, "On Self Respect"

wisdom.sentence: Intolerance is the last defense of the insecure.

wisdom.author: Bernard Cooke

wisdom.sentence: It destroys one's nerves to be amiable every day to the same human being.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Disraeli

wisdom.sentence: It does not matter if you fall down as long as you pick up something from the floor while you get up.
It doesn't matter what you do, it only matters what you say you've done and what you're going to do.

wisdom.author: Bertrand Russell

wisdom.sentence: It is all right to hold a conversation, but you should let go of it now and then.
wisdom.author: Richard Armour

wisdom.sentence: It is always the best policy to tell the truth, unless, of course, you are an exceptionally good liar.
wisdom.author: Jerome K. Jerome

wisdom.sentence: It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness.
It is better for civilization to be going down the drain than to be  coming up it.
wisdom.author: Henry Allen

wisdom.sentence: It is easier to get forgiveness than permission.
It is easier to make a saint out of a libertine than out of a prig.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.sentence: It is easy when we are in prosperity to give advice to the afflicted.
wisdom.author: Aeschylus

wisdom.sentence: It is exactly because a man cannot do a thing that he is a proper judge of it.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.sentence: It is far more impressive when others discover your good qualities without your help.
wisdom.author: Miss Manners

wisdom.sentence: It is generally agreed that "Hello" is an appropriate greeting because if you entered a room and said "Goodbye," it could confuse a lot of people.
wisdom.author: Dolph Sharp, "I'm O.K., You're Not So Hot"

wisdom.sentence: It is impossible for an optimist to be pleasantly surprised.
It is impossible to make anything foolproof because fools are so ingenious.
It is indeed desirable to be well descended, but the glory belongs to our ancestors.
wisdom.author: Plutarch

wisdom.sentence: It is much easier to be critical than to be correct.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Disraeli

wisdom.sentence: It is not enough to have a good mind. The main thing is to use it well.
wisdom.author: Rene Descartes

wisdom.sentence: It is not enough to have great qualities, we should also have the management of them.
wisdom.author: La Rochefoucauld

wisdom.sentence: It is not good for a man to be without knowledge, and he who makes haste with his feet misses his way.
wisdom.author: Proverbs 19:2

wisdom.sentence: It is often easier to ask for forgiveness than to ask for permission.
wisdom.author: Grace Murray Hopper

wisdom.sentence: It is one thing to praise discipline, and another to submit to it.
wisdom.author: Cervantes

wisdom.sentence: It is only people of small moral stature who have to stand on their dignity.
It is only the great men who are truly obscene.	 If they had not dared to be obscene, they could never have dared to be great.
wisdom.author: Havelock Ellis

wisdom.sentence: It is the business of little minds to shrink.
wisdom.author: Carl Sandburg

wisdom.sentence: It is the nature of extreme self-lovers, as they will set an house on fire, and it were but to roast their eggs.
wisdom.author: Francis Bacon

wisdom.sentence: It is the wisdom of crocodiles, that shed tears when they would devour.
wisdom.author: Francis Bacon

wisdom.sentence: It is the wise bird who builds his nest in a tree.
It matters not whether you win or lose; what matters is whether II win or lose.
wisdom.author: Darrin Weinberg

wisdom.sentence: It may be bad manners to talk with your mouth full, but it isn't too good either if you speak when your head is empty.
It may be that your whole purpose in life is simply to serve as a warning to others.
It pays to be obvious, especially if you have a reputation for subtlety.
It seemed the world was divided into good and bad people.  The good ones slept better... while the bad ones seemed to enjoy the waking hours much more.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen, "Side Effects"

wisdom.sentence: It seems to make an auto driver mad if he misses you.
It takes a special kind of courage to face what we all have to face.
It takes all kinds to fill the freeways.
wisdom.author: Crazy Charlie

wisdom.sentence: It takes both a weapon, and two people, to commit a murder.
It takes less time to do a thing right than it does to explain why you did it wrong.
wisdom.author: H.W. Longfellow

wisdom.sentence: It takes two to tell the truth: one to speak and one to hear.
It will be generally found that those who sneer habitually at human nature and affect to despise it, are among its worst and least pleasant examples.
wisdom.author: Charles Dickens

wisdom.sentence: It would be nice to be sure of anything the way some people are of everything.
It's amazing how many people you could be friends with if only they'd make the first approach.
It's amazing how much "mature wisdom" resembles being too tired.
It's amazing how nice people are to you when they know you're going away.
wisdom.author: Michael Arlen

wisdom.sentence: It's bad enough that life is a rat-race, but why do the rats always have to win?
It's better to be quotable than to be honest.
wisdom.author: Tom Stoppard

wisdom.sentence: It's better to be wanted for murder that not to be wanted at all.
wisdom.author: Marty Winch

wisdom.sentence: It's easier to fight for one's principles than to live up to them.
It's easier to get forgiveness for being wrong than forgiveness for being  right.
It's hard not to like a man of many qualities, even if most of them are bad.
It's hard to be humble when you're perfect.
It's hard to keep your shirt on when you're getting something off your chest.
It's interesting to think that many quite distinguished people have bodies similar to yours.
It's only by NOT taking the human race seriously that I retain what fragments of my once considerable mental powers I still possess.
wisdom.author: Roger Noe

wisdom.sentence: It's reassuring to know that if you behave strangely enough, society will take full responsibility for you.
It's sweet to be remembered, but it's often cheaper to be forgotten.
Jealousy is all the fun you think they have.
Just because I turn down a contract on a guy doesn't mean he isn't going to get hit.
wisdom.author: Joey

wisdom.sentence: Just because you're paranoid doesn't mean they AREN'T after you.
"Just out of curiosity does this actually mean something or have some of the few remaining bits of your brain just evaporated?"
wisdom.author: Patricia O Tuama, rissa@killer.DALLAS.TX.US

wisdom.sentence: Just weigh your own hurt against the hurt of all the others, and then do what's best.
wisdom.author: Lovers and Other Strangers

wisdom.sentence: Just when you thought you were winning the rat race, along comes a faster rat!!
Justice always prevails ... three times out of seven!
wisdom.author: Michael J. Wagner

wisdom.sentence: Keep cool, but don't freeze.
wisdom.author: Hellman's Mayonnaise

wisdom.sentence: Keep your mouth shut and people will think you stupid; Open it and you remove all doubt.
Lack of capability is usually disguised by lack of interest.
Lack of money is the root of all evil.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.sentence: Last guys don't finish nice.
wisdom.author: Stanley Kelley, on the cult of victory at all costs

wisdom.sentence: Laughter is the closest distance between two people.
wisdom.author: Victor Borge

wisdom.sentence: Learn from other people's mistakes, you don't have time to make your own.
Let a fool hold his tongue and he will pass for a sage.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.sentence: Let the meek inherit the earth -- they have it coming to them.
wisdom.author: James Thurber

wisdom.sentence: Let's do it.
wisdom.author: Gary Gilmore, to his firing squad

wisdom.sentence: Life is a hospital in which every patient is possessed by the desire to change his bed.
wisdom.author: Charles Baudelaire

wisdom.sentence: Life is a series of rude awakenings.
wisdom.author: R.V. Winkle

wisdom.sentence: Life is a serious burden, which no thinking, humane person would wantonly inflict on someone else.
wisdom.author: Clarence Darrow

wisdom.sentence: Life is an exciting business, and most exciting when it is lived for others.
Life is like bein' on a mule team.  Unless you're the lead mule, all the scenery looks about the same.
"Life would be much simpler and things would get done much faster if it weren't for other people"
wisdom.author: Blore

wisdom.sentence: Lord, defend me from my friends; I can account for my enemies.
wisdom.author: Charles D'Hericault

wisdom.sentence: Love thy neighbor as thyself, but choose your neighborhood.
wisdom.author: Louise Beal

wisdom.sentence: Love your enemies: they'll go crazy trying to figure out what you're up to.
Love your neighbour, yet don't pull down your hedge.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.sentence: Lying is an indispensable part of making life tolerable.
wisdom.author: Bergan Evans

wisdom.sentence: Make no little plans; they have no magic to stir men's blood.
wisdom.author: Daniel Hudson Burnham

wisdom.sentence: Man belongs wherever he wants to go.
wisdom.author: Wernher von Braun

wisdom.sentence: Man has made his bedlam; let him lie in it.
wisdom.author: Fred Allen

wisdom.sentence: Man has never reconciled himself to the ten commandments.
Man invented language to satisfy his deep need to complain.
wisdom.author: Lily Tomlin

wisdom.sentence: Man is a rational animal who always loses his temper when he is called upon to act in accordance with the dictates of reason.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.sentence: Man is the only animal that can remain on friendly terms with the victims he intends to eat until he eats them.
wisdom.author: Samuel Butler (1835-1902)

wisdom.sentence: Man usually avoids attributing cleverness to somebody else -- unless it is an enemy.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.sentence: Man's horizons are bounded by his vision.
Man's unique agony as a species consists in his perpetual conflict between the desire to stand out and the need to blend in.
wisdom.author: Sydney J. Harris

wisdom.sentence: Many a family tree needs trimming.
Many a man that can't direct you to a corner drugstore will get a respectful hearing when age has further impaired his mind.
wisdom.author: Finley Peter Dunne

wisdom.sentence: Many people are desperately looking for some wise advice which will recommend that they do what they want to do.
Many people are secretly interested in life.
Many people feel that if you won't let them make you happy, they'll make you suffer.
Many people feel that they deserve some kind of recognition for all the bad things they haven't done.
Many people resent being treated like the person they really are.
Many receive advice, few profit by it.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.sentence: 'Martyrdom' is the only way a person can become famous without ability.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.sentence: May those that love us love us; and those that don't love us, may God turn their hearts; and if he doesn't turn their hearts, may he turn their ankles so we'll know them by their limping.
May you die in bed at 95, shot by a jealous spouse.
Maybe Jesus was right when he said that the meek shall inherit the earth -- but they inherit very small plots, about six feet by three.
wisdom.author: Lazarus Long

wisdom.sentence: "Maybe we can get together and show off to each other sometimes."
Meekness is uncommon patience in planning a worthwhile revenge.
Men use thought only to justify their wrong doings, and speech only to conceal their thoughts.
wisdom.author: Voltaire

wisdom.sentence: Millions long for immortality who do not know what to do with themselves on a rainy Sunday afternoon.
wisdom.author: Susan Ertz

wisdom.sentence: Mind your own business, then you don't mind mine.
Mix a little foolishness with your serious plans; it's lovely to be silly at the right moment.
wisdom.author: Horace

wisdom.sentence: Modern man is the missing link between apes and human beings.
Modesty is a vastly overrated virtue.
wisdom.author: J.K. Galbraith

wisdom.sentence: More are taken in by hope than by cunning.
wisdom.author: Vauvenargues

wisdom.sentence: More people are flattered into virtue than bullied out of vice.
wisdom.author: R.S. Surtees

wisdom.sentence: Most of our lives are about proving something, either to ourselves or to someone else.
Most of the fear that spoils our life comes from attacking difficulties before we get to them.
wisdom.author: Dr. Frank Crane

wisdom.sentence: Most of your faults are not your fault.
Most people are too busy to have time for anything important.
Most people can do without the essentials, but not without the luxuries.
Most people can't understand how others can blow their noses differently than they do.
wisdom.author: Turgenev

wisdom.sentence: Most people deserve each other.
wisdom.author: Shirley

wisdom.sentence: Most people feel that everyone is entitled to their opinion.
Most people have a mind that's open by appointment only.
Most people have two reasons for doing anything -- a good reason, and the real reason.
Most people in this society who aren't actively mad are, at best, reformed or potential lunatics.
wisdom.author: Susan Sontag

wisdom.sentence: Most people need some of their problems to help take their mind off some of the others.
Most people prefer certainty to truth.
Mother told me to be good but she's been wrong before.
Murder is always a mistake -- one should never do anything one cannot talk about after dinner.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, "The Picture of Dorian Gray"

wisdom.sentence: My brain is my second favorite organ.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.sentence: My method is to take the utmost trouble to find the right thing to say. And then say it with the utmost levity.
wisdom.author: G.B. Shaw

wisdom.sentence: My mind can never know my body, although it has become quite friendly with my legs.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen, on Epistemology

wisdom.sentence: My opinions may have changed, but not the fact that I am right.
My own business always bores me to death; I prefer other people's.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.sentence: My philosophy is: Don't think.
wisdom.author: Charles Manson

wisdom.sentence: Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power.
wisdom.author: Abraham Lincoln

wisdom.sentence: Needs are a function of what other people have.
Neither spread the germs of gossip nor encourage others to do so.
Never argue with a fool -- people might not be able to tell the difference.
Never argue with a man who buys ink by the barrel.
Never ask the barber if you need a haircut.
Never explain.	Your friends do not need it and your enemies will never believe you anyway.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.sentence: Never face facts; if you do you'll never get up in the morning.
wisdom.author: Marlo Thomas

wisdom.sentence: Never forget what a man says to you when he is angry.
Never frighten a small man -- he'll kill you.
Never get into fights with ugly people because they have nothing to lose.
Never insult an alligator until you've crossed the river.
Never kick a man, unless he's down.
Never leave anything to chance; make sure all your crimes are premeditated.
Never pay a compliment as if expecting a receipt.
Never speak ill of yourself, your friends will always say enough on that subject.
wisdom.author: Charles-Maurice De Talleyrand

wisdom.sentence: Never tell a lie unless it is absolutely convenient.
Never trust anybody whose arm is bigger than your leg.
Never underestimate the power of human stupidity.
Never, ever lie to someone you love unless you're absolutely sure they'll never find out the truth.
Nezvannyi gost'--khuzhe tatarina. 	[An uninvited guest is worse than the Mongol invasion]
wisdom.author: Russian proverb

wisdom.sentence: Nice boy, but about as sharp as a sack of wet mice.
wisdom.author: Foghorn Leghorn

wisdom.sentence: No character, however upright, is a match for constantly reiterated attacks, however false.
wisdom.author: Alexander Hamilton

wisdom.sentence: No guest is so welcome in a friend's house that he will not become a nuisance after three days.
wisdom.author: Titus Maccius Plautus

wisdom.sentence: No man is an island, but some of us are long peninsulas.
No man is useless who has a friend, and if we are loved we are indispensable.
wisdom.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

wisdom.sentence: No man would listen to you talk if he didn't know it was his turn next.
wisdom.author: E.W. Howe

wisdom.sentence: No matter what happens, there is always someone who knew it would.
No one becomes depraved in a moment.
wisdom.author: Decimus Junius Juvenalis

wisdom.sentence: No one can have a higher opinion of him than I have, and I think he's a dirty little beast.
wisdom.author: W.S. Gilbert

wisdom.sentence: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
wisdom.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

wisdom.sentence: No one can put you down without your full cooperation.
"No one gets too old to learn a new way of being stupid."
No one knows what he can do till he tries.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.sentence: No one regards what is before his feet; we all gaze at the stars.
wisdom.author: Quintus Ennius

wisdom.sentence: No one so thoroughly appreciates the value of constructive criticism as the one who's giving it.
wisdom.author: Hal Chadwick

wisdom.sentence: No question is so difficult as one to which the answer is obvious.
No snowflake in an avalanche ever feels responsible.
No sooner said than done -- so acts your man of worth.
wisdom.author: Quintus Ennius

wisdom.sentence: Nobody can be as agreeable as an uninvited guest.
Nobody ever forgets where he buried the hatchet.
wisdom.author: Kin Hubbard

wisdom.sentence: Nobody knows the trouble I've been.
Nobody knows what goes between his cold toes and his warm ears.
wisdom.author: Roy Harper

wisdom.sentence: Nobody wants constructive criticism.  It's all we can do to put up with constructive praise.
Nothing astonishes men so much as common sense and plain dealing.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.sentence: Nothing makes one so vain as being told that one is a sinner. Conscience makes egotists of us all.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.sentence: Nothing shortens a journey so pleasantly as an account of misfortunes at which the hearer is permitted to laugh.
wisdom.author: Quentin Crisp

wisdom.sentence: O Lord, grant that we may always be right, for Thou knowest we will never change our minds.
Objects are lost only because people look where they are not rather than where they are.
Obstacles are what you see when you take your eyes off your goal.
Oh this age!  How tasteless and ill-bred it is.
wisdom.author: Gaius Valerius Catullus

wisdom.sentence: Oh wearisome condition of humanity! Born under one law, to another bound.
wisdom.author: Fulke Greville, Lord Brooke

wisdom.sentence: Old age and treachery will overcome youth and skill.
Old age is always fifteen years old than I am.
wisdom.author: B. Baruch

wisdom.sentence: Old age is the harbor of all ills.
wisdom.author: Bion

wisdom.sentence: Old age is the most unexpected of things that can happen to a man.
wisdom.author: Trotsky

wisdom.sentence: Old age is too high a price to pay for maturity.
Old men are fond of giving good advice to console themselves for their inability to set a bad example.
wisdom.author: La Rochefoucauld, "Maxims"

wisdom.sentence: On Monday mornings I am dedicated to the proposition that all men are created jerks.
wisdom.author: H. Allen Smith, "Let the Crabgrass Grow"

wisdom.sentence: One advantage of talking to yourself is that you know at least somebody's listening.
wisdom.author: Franklin P. Jones

wisdom.sentence: One can never consent to creep when one feels an impulse to soar.
wisdom.author: Helen Keller

wisdom.sentence: One family builds a wall, two families enjoy it.
One is not superior merely because one sees the world as odious.
wisdom.author: Chateaubriand (1768-1848)

wisdom.sentence: One is often kept in the right road by a rut.
wisdom.author: Gustave Droz

wisdom.sentence: One man tells a falsehood, a hundred repeat it as true.
One measure of friendship consists not in the number of things friends can discuss, but in the number of things they need no longer mention.
wisdom.author: Clifton Fadiman

wisdom.sentence: One nice thing about egotists: they don't talk about other people.
One of the large consolations for experiencing anything unpleasant is the knowledge that one can communicate it.
wisdom.author: Joyce Carol Oates

wisdom.sentence: One of the pleasures of reading old letters is the knowledge that they need no answer.
wisdom.author: George Gordon, Lord Byron

wisdom.sentence: One of the worst of my many faults is that I'm too critical of myself.
One would like to stroke and caress human beings, but one dares not do so, because they bite.
wisdom.author: Vladimir Il'ich Lenin

wisdom.sentence: Only a fool has no doubts.
Only a mediocre person is always at his best.
wisdom.author: Laurence Peter

wisdom.sentence: Only fools are quoted.
wisdom.author: Anonymous

wisdom.sentence: Only kings, presidents, editors, and people with tapeworms have the right to use the editorial "we".
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.sentence: Only someone with nothing to be sorry for smiles back at the rear of an elephant.
Only the hypocrite is really rotten to the core.
wisdom.author: Hannah Arendt

wisdom.sentence: Only two of my personalities are schizophrenic, but one of them is paranoid and the other one is out to get him.
Optimism is the content of small men in high places.
wisdom.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald, "The Crack Up"

wisdom.sentence: Original thought is like original sin: both happened before you were born to people you could not have possibly met.
wisdom.author: Fran Lebowitz, "Social Studies"

wisdom.sentence: Others can stop you temporarily, only you can do it permanently.
Others will look to you for stability, so hide when you bite your nails.
Out of the crooked timber of humanity no straight thing can ever be made.
wisdom.author: Immanuel Kant

wisdom.sentence: Paranoia doesn't mean the whole world isn't out to get you.
Paranoia is heightened awareness.
Paranoia is simply an optimistic outlook on life.
Paranoid schizophrenics outnumber their enemies at least two to one.
Paranoids are people, too; they have their own problems.  It's easy to criticize, but if everybody hated you, you'd be paranoid too.
wisdom.author: D.J. Hicks

wisdom.sentence: Passionate hatred can give meaning and purpose to an empty life.
wisdom.author: Eric Hoffer

wisdom.sentence: Patience is a minor form of despair, disguised as virtue.
wisdom.author: Ambrose Bierce, on qualifiers

wisdom.sentence: People are like onions -- you cut them up, and they make you cry.
People are unconditionally guaranteed to be full of defects.
People don't change; they only become more so.
People don't usually make the same mistake twice -- they make it three times, four time, five times...
People love high ideals, but they got to be about 33-percent plausible.
wisdom.author: The Best of Will Rogers

wisdom.sentence: People need good lies.	There are too many bad ones.
wisdom.author: Bokonon, "Cat's Cradle" by Kurt Vonnegut, Jr.

wisdom.sentence: People often find it easier to be a result of the past than a cause of the future.
People respond to people who respond.
People say I live in my own little fantasy world... well, at least they *know* me there!
wisdom.author: D.L. Roth

wisdom.sentence: People seem to enjoy things more when they know a lot of other people have been left out on the pleasure.
wisdom.author: Russell Baker

wisdom.sentence: People tend to make rules for others and exceptions for themselves.
People who claim they don't let little things bother them have never slept in a room with a single mosquito.
People who fight fire with fire usually end up with ashes.
wisdom.author: Abigail Van Buren

wisdom.sentence: People who have no faults are terrible; there is no way of taking advantage of them.
People who have what they want are very fond of telling people who haven't what they want that they don't want it.
wisdom.author: Ogden Nash

wisdom.sentence: People who make no mistakes do not usually make anything.
People who push both buttons should get their wish.
People who take cat naps don't usually sleep in a cat's cradle.
People who take cold baths never have rheumatism, but they have cold baths.
People who think they know everything greatly annoy those of us who do.
People will accept your ideas much more readily if you tell them that Benjamin Franklin said it first.
People will do tomorrow what they did today because that is what they did yesterday.
People with narrow minds usually have broad tongues.
Perhaps the world's second worst crime is boredom.  The first is being a bore.
wisdom.author: Cecil Beaton

wisdom.sentence: Personifiers of the world, unite!  You have nothing to lose but Mr. Dignity!
wisdom.author: Bernadette Bosky

wisdom.sentence: Please don't put a strain on our friendship by asking me to do something for you.
Please don't recommend me to your friends-- it's difficult enough to cope with you alone.
Please forgive me if, in the heat of battle, I sometimes forget which side I'm on.
Practically perfect people never permit sentiment to muddle their thinking.
wisdom.author: Mary Poppins

wisdom.sentence: Pretend to spank me -- I'm a pseudo-masochist!
Progress is impossible without change, and those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
wisdom.author: G.B. Shaw

wisdom.sentence: Put your brain in gear before starting your mouth in motion.
Put your trust in those who are worthy.
Questions are never indiscreet, answers sometimes are.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.sentence: "Quite frankly, I don't like you humans.  After what you all have done, I find being 'inhuman' a compliment."
wisdom.author: Spider Robinson, "Callahan's Secret"

wisdom.sentence: Rarely do people communicate; they just take turns talking.
Relations are simply a tedious pack of people, who haven't the remotest knowledge of how to live, nor the smallest instinct about when to die.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, "The Importance of Being Earnest"

wisdom.sentence: ... relaxed in the manner of a man who has no need to put up a front of any kind.
wisdom.author: John Ball, "Mark One: the Dummy"

wisdom.sentence: Remember: Silly is a state of Mind, Stupid is a way of Life.
wisdom.author: Dave Butler

wisdom.sentence: Revenge is a form of nostalgia.
Revenge is a meal best served cold.
Rudeness is a weak man's imitation of strength.
Saints should always be judged guilty until they are proved innocent.
wisdom.author: George Orwell, "Reflections on Gandhi"

wisdom.sentence: Sanity and insanity overlap a fine grey line.
Sanity is the trademark of a weak mind.
wisdom.author: Mark Harrold

wisdom.sentence: Say no, then negotiate.
wisdom.author: Helga

wisdom.sentence: Say something you'll be sorry for, I love receiving apologies.
Scenery is here, wish you were beautiful.
Schizophrenia beats being alone.
Screw up your courage!	You've screwed up everything else.
"See - the thing is - I'm an absolutist.  I mean, kind of ... in a way ..."
Sentimentality -- that's what we call the sentiment we don't share.
wisdom.author: Graham Greene

wisdom.sentence: Serenity through viciousness.
Shall we make a new rule of life from tonight: always to try to be a little kinder than is necessary?
wisdom.author: J.M. Barrie

wisdom.sentence: Shame is an improper emotion invented by pietists to oppress the human race.
wisdom.author: Robert Preston, Toddy, "Victor/Victoria"

wisdom.sentence: She often gave herself very good advice (though she very seldom followed it).
wisdom.author: Lewis Carroll

wisdom.sentence: Short people get rained on last.
Show your affection, which will probably meet with pleasant response.
Sin boldly.
wisdom.author: Martin Luther

wisdom.sentence: Sin has many tools, but a lie is the handle which fits them all.
Sin lies only in hurting other people unnecessarily.  All other "sins" are invented nonsense.  (Hurting yourself is not sinful -- just stupid).
wisdom.author: Lazarus Long

wisdom.sentence: Since we have to speak well of the dead, let's knock them while they're alive.
wisdom.author: John Sloan

wisdom.sentence: Since we're all here, we must not be all there.
wisdom.author: Bob "Mountain" Beck

wisdom.sentence: Sinners can repent, but stupid is forever.
So live that you wouldn't be ashamed to sell the family parrot to the town gossip.
Some don't prefer the pursuit of happiness to the happiness of pursuit.
Some men are born mediocre, some men achieve mediocrity, and some men have mediocrity thrust upon them.
wisdom.author: Joseph Heller, "Catch-22"

wisdom.sentence: Some men are discovered; others are found out.
Some men love truth so much that they seem to be in continual fear lest she should catch a cold on overexposure.
wisdom.author: Samuel Butler

wisdom.sentence: Some of the things that live the longest in peoples' memories never really happened.
Some people around here wouldn't recognize subtlety if it hit them on the head.
Some people cause happiness wherever they go; others, whenever they go.
Some people have a way about them that seems to say: "If I have only one life to live, let me live it as a jerk."
Some people have parts that are so private they themselves have no knowledge of them.
Some people's mouths work faster than their brains.  They say things they haven't even thought of yet.
Some rise by sin and some by virtue fall.
Someone will try to honk your nose today.
Something unpleasant is coming when men are anxious to tell the truth.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Disraeli

wisdom.sentence: Sometimes I worry about being a success in a mediocre world.
wisdom.author: Lily Tomlin

wisdom.sentence: Sometimes when you look into his eyes you get the feeling that someone else is driving.
wisdom.author: David Letterman

wisdom.sentence: Speak softly and carry a +6 two-handed sword.
Speak softly and own a big, mean Doberman.
wisdom.author: Dave Millman

wisdom.sentence: Start every day off with a smile and get it over with.
wisdom.author: W.C. Fields

wisdom.sentence: Start the day with a smile.  After that you can be your nasty old self again.
Stay together, drag each other down.
Still looking for the glorious results of my misspent youth.  Say, do you have a map to the next joint?
Stupidity got us into this mess -- why can't it get us out?
Stupidity is its own reward.
Style may not be the answer, but at least it's a workable alternative.
Subtlety is the art of saying what you think and getting out of the way before it is understood.
Success is a journey, not a destination.
Success is getting what you want; happiness is wanting what you get.
Success is in the minds of Fools.
wisdom.author: William Wrenshaw, 1578

wisdom.sentence: Success is relative: It is what we can make of the mess we have made of things.
wisdom.author: T.S. Eliot, "The Family Reunion"

wisdom.sentence: Succumb to natural tendencies.	Be hateful and boring.
Such a fine first dream! But they laughed at me; they said I had made it up.
Suicide is simply a case of mistaken identity.
Suicide is the sincerest form of self-criticism.
wisdom.author: Donald Kaul

wisdom.sentence: Support your local Search and Rescue unit -- get lost.
Sure he's sharp as a razor ... he's a two-dimensional pinhead!
Surly to bed, surly to rise, makes you about average.
Tact in audacity is knowing how far you can go without going too far.
wisdom.author: Jean Cocteau

wisdom.sentence: Tact is the ability to tell a man he has an open mind when he has a hole in his head.
Tact is the art of making a point without making an enemy.
Take a lesson from the whale; the only time he gets speared is when he raises to spout.
Talk is cheap because supply always exceeds demand.
Talk sense to a fool and he calls you foolish.
wisdom.author: Euripides

wisdom.sentence: Talking much about oneself can also be a means to conceal oneself.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.sentence: Tart words make no friends; a spoonful of honey will catch more flies than a gallon of vinegar.
wisdom.author: B. Franklin

wisdom.sentence: Tell a man there are 300 billion stars in the universe and he'll believe you. Tell him a bench has wet paint on it and he'll have to touch to be sure.
Tell me what to think!!!
Telling the truth to people who misunderstand you is generally promoting a falsehood, isn't it?
wisdom.author: A. Hope

wisdom.sentence: "That boy's about as sharp as a pound of wet liver"
wisdom.author: Foghorn Leghorn

wisdom.sentence: That must be wonderful: I don't understand it at all.
wisdom.author: Moliere

wisdom.sentence: That which is not good for the swarm, neither is it good for the bee.
That's always the way when you discover something new; everyone thinks you're crazy.
wisdom.author: Evelyn E. Smith

wisdom.sentence: The aim of a joke is not to degrade the human being but to remind him that he is already degraded.
wisdom.author: George Orwell

wisdom.sentence: The angry man always thinks he can do more than he can.
wisdom.author: Albertano of Brescia

wisdom.sentence: The average nutritional value of promises is roughly zero.
The average, healthy, well-adjusted adult gets up at seven-thirty in the morning feeling just terrible.
wisdom.author: Jean Kerr

wisdom.sentence: The best laid plans of mice and men are usually about equal.
wisdom.author: Blair

wisdom.sentence: The best portion of a good man's life, his little, nameless, unremembered acts of kindness and love.
wisdom.author: Wordsworth

wisdom.sentence: The best thing about growing older is that it takes such a long time.
The best way to get rid of worries is to let them die of neglect.
The best way to keep your friends is not to give them away.
The bigger they are, the harder they hit.
The biggest problem with communication is the illusion that it has occurred.
The bland leadeth the bland and they both shall fall into the kitsch.
The brotherhood of man is not a mere poet's dream; it is a most depressing and humiliating reality.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.sentence: The difference between a good haircut and a bad one is seven days.
The difference between genius and stupidity is that genius has its limits.
The discerning person is always at a disadvantage.
The distinction between true and false appears to become increasingly blurred by... the pollution of the language.
wisdom.author: Arne Tiselius

wisdom.sentence: The end of the human race will be that it will eventually die of civilization.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.sentence: The forest is safe because a lion lives therein and the lion is safe because it lives in a forest.  Likewise the friendship of persons rests on mutual help.
wisdom.author: Laukikanyay.

wisdom.sentence: The full potentialities of human fury cannot be reached until a friend of both parties tactfully interferes.
wisdom.author: G.K. Chesterton

wisdom.sentence: The Golden Rule is of no use to you whatever unless you realize it is your move.
wisdom.author: Frank Crane

wisdom.sentence: The great merit of society is to make one appreciate solitude.
wisdom.author: Charles Chincholles, "Reflections on the Art of Life"

wisdom.sentence: The greatest of faults is to be conscious of none.
The greatest remedy for anger is delay.
The hardest thing is to disguise your feelings when you put a lot of relatives on the train for home.
The hatred of relatives is the most violent.
wisdom.author: Tacitus (c.55 - c.117)

wisdom.sentence: ... the heat come 'round and busted me for smiling on a cloudy day.
The help people need most urgently is help in admitting that they need help.
The human mind treats a new idea the way the body treats a strange protein -- it rejects it.
wisdom.author: P. Medawar

wisdom.sentence: The human race never solves any of its problems.  It merely outlives them.
wisdom.author: David Gerrold

wisdom.sentence: The idle mind knows not what it is it wants.
wisdom.author: Quintus Ennius

wisdom.sentence: The important thing is not to stop questioning.
The kind of danger people most enjoy is the kind they can watch from a safe place.
The knowledge that makes us cherish innocence makes innocence unattainable.
wisdom.author: Irving Howe

wisdom.sentence: The last time I saw him he was walking down Lover's Lane holding his own hand.
wisdom.author: Fred Allen

wisdom.sentence: The Lord prefers common-looking people.	 That is the reason that He makes so many of them.
wisdom.author: Abraham Lincoln

wisdom.sentence: The louder he talked of his honour, the faster we counted our spoons.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.sentence: The major advances in civilization are processes that all but wreck the societies in which they occur.
wisdom.author: A.N. Whitehead

wisdom.sentence: The man who raises a fist has run out of ideas.
wisdom.author: H.G. Wells, "Time After Time"

wisdom.sentence: The meeting of two personalities is like the contact of two chemical substances: if there is any reaction, both are transformed.
wisdom.author: Carl Jung

wisdom.sentence: The minute a man is convinced that he is interesting, he isn't.
The more I know men the more I like my horse.
The more I see of men the more I admire dogs.
wisdom.author: Mme De Sevigne, 1626-1696

wisdom.sentence: The more we disagree, the more chance there is that at least one of us is right.
The most disagreeable thing that your worst enemy says to your face does not approach what your best friends say behind your back.
wisdom.author: Alfred De Musset

wisdom.sentence: The most hopelessly stupid man is he who is not aware that he is wise.
The nice thing about egotists is that they don't talk about other people.
wisdom.author: Lucille S. Harper

wisdom.sentence: The odds are a million to one against your being one in a million.
The older a man gets, the farther he had to walk to school as a boy.
The older I grow, the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom.
wisdom.author: H.L. Mencken

wisdom.sentence: The only difference between the saint and the sinner is that every saint has a past and every sinner has a future.

wisdom.sentence: The only really decent thing to do behind a person's back is pat it.

wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.sentence: The only two things that motivate me and that matter to me are revenge and guilt.

wisdom.sentence: The only way to amuse some people is to slip and fall on an icy pavement.

wisdom.sentence: The opposite of talking isn't listening.  The opposite of talking is waiting.

wisdom.sentence: The part of the world that people find most puzzling is the part called "Me".

wisdom.sentence: The propriety of some persons seems to consist in having improper thoughts about their neighbours.
wisdom.author: F.H. Bradley

wisdom.sentence: The right half of the brain controls the left half of the body.	 This means that only left handed people are in their right mind.
"The Schizophrenic: An Unauthorized Autobiography"

The secret of happiness is total disregard of everybody.
The shifts of Fortune test the reliability of friends.
wisdom.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

wisdom.sentence: The strong give up and move away, while the weak give up and stay.

wisdom.author: The Silver Surfer

wisdom.sentence: The surest way to corrupt a youth is to instruct him to hold in higher esteem those who think alike than those who think differently.
wisdom.author: Nietzsche

wisdom.sentence: The things that interest people most are usually none of their business.

wisdom.author: Fran Lebowitz, "Metropolitan Life"

wisdom.sentence: The trouble with telling a good story is that it invariably reminds the other fellow of a dull one.
wisdom.author: Sid Caesar

wisdom.sentence: The truth about a man lies first and foremost in what he hides.

wisdom.sentence: The very remembrance of my former misfortune proves a new one to me.

wisdom.sentence: The way of the world is to praise dead saints and prosecute live ones.

wisdom.sentence: The way some people find fault, you'd think there was some kind of reward.
The way to a man's heart is through the left ventricle.

wisdom.sentence: The world needs more people like us and fewer like them.

wisdom.sentence: The worst is not so long as we can say "This is the worst."

wisdom.sentence: The worst part of having success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.
wisdom.author: Bette Midler

wisdom.sentence: The worst sin towards our fellow creatures is not to hate them, but to be indifferent to them; that's the essence of inhumanity.

wisdom.sentence: The worst thing about some men is that when they are not drunk they are sober.

wisdom.sentence: There are few people more often in the wrong than those who cannot endure to be thought so.

wisdom.sentence: There are no emotional victims, only volunteers.

wisdom.sentence: There are no great men, only great challenges that ordinary men are forced by circumstances to meet.

wisdom.sentence: There are only two kinds of men -- the dead and the deadly.

wisdom.sentence: There are people so addicted to exaggeration that they can't tell the truth without lying.

wisdom.sentence: There are two types of people in this world, good and bad.  The good sleep better, but the bad seem to enjoy the waking hours much more.

wisdom.sentence: There comes a time to stop being angry.

wisdom.sentence: There is a certain frame of mind to which a cemetery is, if not an antidote, at least an alleviation.  If you are in a fit of the blues, go nowhere else.

wisdom.sentence: There is brutality and there is honesty.  There is no such thing as brutal honesty.

wisdom.sentence: There is no sadder sight than a young pessimist.

wisdom.sentence: There is nothing more silly than a silly laugh.

wisdom.sentence: There is nothing stranger in a strange land than the stranger who comes to visit.

wisdom.sentence: There may be said to be two classes of people in the world; those who constantly divide the people of the world into two classes and those who do not.

wisdom.sentence: There's a fine line between courage and foolishness.  Too bad it's not a fence.

wisdom.sentence: They also serve who only stand and wait.
