wisdom.sentence: They are ill discoverers that think there is no land, when they can see nothing but sea.
wisdom.author: Francis Bacon

wisdom.sentence: "They told me I was gullible ... and I believed them!"
They're only trying to make me LOOK paranoid!
"They're unfriendly, which is fortunate, really.  They'd be difficult to like."
wisdom.author: Avon

wisdom.sentence: Thinking you know something is a sure way to blind yourself.

wisdom.sentence: This generation doesn't have emotional baggage.	 We have emotional moving vans.

wisdom.sentence: Those of you who think you know everything are annoying those of us who do.

wisdom.sentence: Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.

wisdom.sentence: Those who don't know, talk.  Those who don't talk, know.

wisdom.sentence: To be is to be related.
wisdom.author: C.J. Keyser.

wisdom.sentence: To be trusted is a greater compliment than to be loved.

wisdom.sentence: To criticize the incompetent is easy; it is more difficult to criticize the competent.

wisdom.sentence: To find a friend one must close one eye; to keep him -- two.

wisdom.sentence: To keep your friends treat them kindly; to kill them, treat them often.

To make an enemy, do someone a favor.
To refuse praise is to seek praise twice.

wisdom.sentence: To understand the heart and mind of a person, look not at what he has already achieved, but at what he aspires to do.

wisdom.sentence: Troglodytism does not necessarily imply a low cultural level.

wisdom.sentence: Try to be the best of whatever you are, even if what you are is no good.

wisdom.sentence: Unless you love someone, nothing else makes any sense.
wisdom.author: E.E. Cummings

wisdom.sentence: Virtue does not always demand a heavy sacrifice -- only the willingness to make it when necessary.

wisdom.sentence: Virtue is not left to stand alone.  He who practices it will have neighbors.

wisdom.sentence: Virtue would go far if vanity did not keep it company.

wisdom.sentence: Visits always give pleasure: if not on arrival, then on the departure.

wisdom.sentence: Waking a person unnecessarily should not be considered a capital crime. For a first offense, that is.
Walk softly and carry a BFG-9000.
Walk softly and carry a big stick.

wisdom.sentence: Walk softly and carry a megawatt laser.

We all know that no one understands anything that isn't funny.

wisdom.sentence: We are all born mad.  Some remain so.

wisdom.sentence: We are all dying -- and we're gonna be dead for a long time.

wisdom.sentence: We are all so much together and yet we are all dying of loneliness.

wisdom.sentence: We are anthill men upon an anthill world.

wisdom.sentence: We ARE as gods and might as well get good at it.

wisdom.sentence: We are each only one drop in a great ocean -- but some of the drops sparkle!

wisdom.sentence: We are so fond of each other because our ailments are the same.

wisdom.sentence: We give advice, but we cannot give the wisdom to profit by it.

wisdom.sentence: We have more to fear from the bungling of the incompetent than from the machinations of the wicked.

wisdom.sentence: We may not return the affection of those who like us, but we always respect their good judgement.

wisdom.sentence: We seldom repent talking too little, but very often talking too much.

wisdom.sentence: Well, I'm disenchanted too.  We're all disenchanted.

wisdom.sentence: What good is it if you talk in flowers, and they think in pastry?

wisdom.sentence: What upsets me is not that you lied to me, but that from now on I can no longer believe you.

wisdom.sentence: What we see depends on mainly what we look for.

wisdom.sentence: Whatever you want to do, you have to do something else first.

wisdom.sentence: When you dig another out of trouble, you've got a place to bury your own.

... whether it is better to spend a life not knowing what you want or to spend a life knowing exactly what you want and that you will never have it.

wisdom.sentence: While anyone can admit to themselves they were wrong, the true test is admission to someone else.

wisdom.sentence: Why, every one as they like; as the good woman said when she kissed her cow.

wisdom.sentence: Will your long-winded speeches never end? What ails you that you keep on arguing?

wisdom.sentence: Winter is the season in which people try to keep the house as warm as it was in the summer, when they complained about the heat.

wisdom.sentence: Ye've also got to remember that ... respectable people do the most astonishin' things to preserve their respectability.  Thank God I'm not respectable.

wisdom.sentence: Yes, but every time I try to see things your way, I get a headache.
Yield to Temptation ... it may not pass your way again.

wisdom.sentence: You ain't learning nothing when you're talking.
You are a wish to be here wishing yourself.

wisdom.sentence: You are absolute plate-glass. I see to the very back of your mind.

wisdom.sentence: You are not a fool just because you have done something foolish -- only if the folly of it escapes you.

wisdom.sentence: You can destroy your now by worrying about tomorrow.

wisdom.sentence: You can't carve your way to success without cutting remarks.

wisdom.sentence: You can't have your cake and let your neighbor eat it too.

wisdom.sentence: You can't hold a man down without staying down with him.

wisdom.sentence: You can't learn too soon that the most useful thing about a principle is that it can always be sacrificed to expediency.

wisdom.sentence: You can't play your friends like marks, kid.

wisdom.sentence: You can't start worrying about what's going to happen.	You get spastic enough worrying about what's happening now.

wisdom.sentence: "You can't teach people to be lazy - either they have it, or they don't."

wisdom.sentence: You don't have to explain something you never said.

wisdom.sentence: You give me space to belong to myself yet without separating me  from your own life.  May it all turn out to your happiness.

wisdom.sentence: You got to be very careful if you don't know where you're going, because you might not get there.

wisdom.sentence: You have not converted a man because you have silenced him.

wisdom.sentence: You humans are all alike.

wisdom.sentence: You know how to win a victory, Hannibal, but not how to use it.

wisdom.sentence: You know it's going to be a bad day when you want to put on the clothes you wore home from the party and there aren't any.

wisdom.sentence: You know it's Monday when you wake up and it's Tuesday.

wisdom.sentence: You know what they say -- the sweetest word in the English language is revenge.

wisdom.sentence: You know you are getting old when you think you should drive the speed limit.

wisdom.sentence: You may be sure that when a man begins to call himself a "realist," he is preparing to do something he is secretly ashamed of doing.
wisdom.author: Sydney Harris

wisdom.sentence: You may easily play a joke on a man who likes to argue -- agree with him.

wisdom.sentence: You never gain something but that you lose something.

wisdom.sentence: You never get a second chance to make a first impression.

wisdom.sentence: You never learn anything by doing it right.

wisdom.sentence: You shall judge of a man by his foes as well as by his friends.

wisdom.sentence: You should avoid hedging, at least that's what I think.

wisdom.author: A. Bax, "Farewell My Youth"

wisdom.sentence: You shouldn't wallow in self-pity.  But it's OK to put your feet in it and swish them around a little.

wisdom.sentence: You want to know why I kept getting promoted?  Because my mouth knows more than my brain.
wisdom.author: W.G.

wisdom.sentence: You won't skid if you stay in a rut.

wisdom.sentence: You'd best be snoozin', 'cause you don't be gettin' no work done at 5 a.m. anyway.
wisdom.author: From the wall of the Wurster Hall stairwell

wisdom.sentence: You'd better smile when they watch you, smile like you're in control.

wisdom.sentence: You're always thinking you're gonna be the one that makes 'em act different.

wisdom.sentence: You're either part of the solution or part of the problem.

wisdom.sentence: You're never too old to become younger.

wisdom.sentence: You've always made the mistake of being yourself.

wisdom.sentence: You've been telling me to relax all the way here, and now you're telling me just to be myself?

wisdom.sentence: Young men think old men are fools; but old men know young men are fools.

wisdom.sentence: Young men, hear an old man to whom old men hearkened when he was young.
wisdom.author: Augustus Caesar

wisdom.sentence: Your conscience never stops you from doing anything.  It just stops you from enjoying it.

wisdom.author: Richard Bach, "Illusions"

wisdom.sentence: Youth -- not a time of life but a state of mind... a predominance of courage over timidity, of the appetite for adventure over the love of ease.
wisdom.author: Robert F. Kennedy

wisdom.sentence: Youth is a blunder, manhood a struggle, old age a regret.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Disraeli, "Coningsby"

wisdom.sentence: Youth is a disease from which we all recover.
